thread.title: As the Liberals make eyes at One Nation, their marriage with the Nationals is on the rocks
thread.title_full: As the Liberals make eyes at One Nation, their marriage with the Nationals is on the rocks

author: Andrew P Street
title: As the Liberals make eyes at One Nation, their marriage with the Nationals is on the rocks
text:
As the Liberals make eyes at One Nation, their marriage with the Nationals is on the rocks 
How toxic must a relationship get for One Nation to seem like the sane, sexy alternative? Andrew P Street twitter TWEET More 
Any relationship expert will tell you that certain things are vital to keep a partnership strong. Respect. Communication. Not involving One Nation. Stuff like that. Bushfires across NSW remain out of control Play Video Preferences for Pauline angers Joyce Preferences for Pauline angers Joyce 
Deputy PM Barnaby Joyce isn't happy the WA Liberal Party is preferencing One Nation over the Nationals but Pauline Hanson says her party is a force that can't be ignored. Up Next Bushfires across NSW remain out of control Play Video Bushfires across NSW remain out of control Bushfires across NSW remain out of control 
Specialist teams head into five zones across New South Wales in an attempt to assess how many properties have been damaged or destroyed following Sunday's bushfire emergency. Vision courtesy Seven News Melbourne. Up Next Traffic chaos caused by Taxi protest Play Video Traffic chaos caused by Taxi protest Traffic chaos caused by Taxi protest 
Taxi drivers cause chaos in Melbourneâs CBD as they blockaded the Bolte Bridge during the morning peak, expressing their anger over plans to overhaul the industry. Vision courtesy Seven News Melbourne. Up Next Nationals angered over One Nation preference deal Play Video Nationals angered over One Nation ... Nationals angered over One Nation preference deal 
Pauline Hanson says she hopes a new preference arrangement with the Western Australian Liberals will set the scene for a federal deal. Vision courtesy Seven News Melbourne. Up Next Renewable blame game Renewable blame game 
The Liberal Party has been accused by Labor of lying about the reason for South Australia's blackouts by blaming renewable energy, something Malcolm Turnbull rejects. Courtesy ABC News 24. Up Next Life sentence for Robert Xie Play Video Life sentence for Robert Xie Life sentence for Robert Xie 
Justice Elizabeth Fullerton sentenced convicted murderer Robert Xie, who was found guilty of the murders of the five members of the Lin family in July of 2009, to life imprisonment without possibility of parole. Up Next CSIRO errors risk Aboriginal rock art Play Video CSIRO errors risk Aboriginal rock art CSIRO errors risk Aboriginal rock art 
A series of CSIRO errors has put Burrup Peninsula's collection of indigenous rock art at risk from atmospheric acid levels. Up Next Wild weather continues across Australia Play Video Wild weather continues across Australia Wild weather continues across Australia 
Four of the Queensland's towns recorded the hottest temperatures in history on Saturday while West Australia is battling a flood crisis. (Video courtesy: Seven News) More videos Preferences for Pauline angers Joyce 
Deputy PM Barnaby Joyce isn't happy the WA Liberal Party is preferencing One Nation over the Nationals but Pauline Hanson says her party is a force that can't be ignored. 
It's fair to ask why the Liberals would carry this abandonment of the party that's allowing them to govern while knowing that it only takes one disgruntled Nats-aligned MP to cross the floor and the government no longer has a majority. 
However, the answer – blind terror of being ousted in WA – means that survival takes precedence over trivial matters like "legislating anything at all after giving One Nation the balance of power". That, after all, is a problem for after the election. SHARE Dignity. Quiet dignity. Photo: Andrew Meares 
Now, let's keep this in perspective: "preference deal" means the order on those how to vote cards handed out at polling stations. And the Liberal-National Coalition has been characterised of late by both sides making clear how much contempt they have for each other. 
There was the gleeful extortion the Nationals made in their deal with the new PM when Turnbull rolled Tony Abbott, locking the government into unpopular policies like no action on climate change and no movement on marriage equality. Advertisement 
And the Libs returned the respect in November when Attorney-General George Brandis showed just how much the Liberals valued their colleagues by describing the Queensland Liberal National Party as "not very good" and "very very mediocre", before adding that "I think there might be a revisiting of things" regarding the merger of the two parties in Queensland. 
Still, preferencing the party currently outpolling the Nationals on their home turf is a new level of naked aggression from the Libs, and Nationals leader Barnaby Joyce has made clear how hurt he is by the decision . "When you step away from [the Liberal-National deal], there's one thing you can absolutely be assured of is that we are going to be in opposition," he snarled to reporters. 
However, federal government figures are talking about how great an idea it is, because that wound isn't going to salt itself. 
"The One Nation of today is a very different beast to what it was 20 years ago," federal Industry Minister Arthur Sinodinos told the ABC on Sunday with a straight face. "They're a lot more sophisticated … Our job is to treat them as any other party." 
Trade Minister Steve Ciobo was also determined to pretend aligning with conspiracy theorists and " sovereign citizens " made perfect sense on Monday morning. 
"If you look at, for example, how Pauline Hanson's gone about putting her support in the Senate, you'll see that she's often voting in favour of government legislation," he hedged. "There's a certain amount of economic rationalism, a certain amount of approach that's reflective of what it is we are trying to do to govern Australia in a fiscally responsible way." 
Now, it's reassuring that Arthur Sinodinos can remember what One Nation were like 20 years ago, given his forgetfulness in his testimony before the Independent Commission Against Corruption. 
But Sinodinos is right about them being more sophisticated. Why, Pauline Hanson used to manipulate bigots by pretending that we're at risk of being "swamped by Asians" - now she manipulates bigots by pretending we're at risk of being "swamped by Muslims" . 
So yeah, Artie: they're a totally different beast. Well observed, buddy! 
What other things would the Liberals now be tacitly supporting in a preference deal?
